alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Pikes Peak above 11000 Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 2:14PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Fremont, southern Teller and west central El Paso Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 214 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cripple Creek to near Royal Gorge. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong winds will extend well away from any precipitation. Locations impacted include... Manitou Springs, Cripple Creek, Victor, Pikes Peak, Royal Gorge and Canon City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
